item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "I'll be more enthusiastic about encouraging thinking outside the box when there's evidence of any thinking going on inside it." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "There are only two ways to live your life. One is as though nothing is a miracle. The other is as though everything is a miracle." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by P. G. Wodehouse
item.description: "I'm not absolutely certain of the facts, but I rather fancy it's Shakespeare who says that it's always just when a fellow is feeling particularly braced with things in general that Fate sneaks up behind him with the bit of lead piping." -- P. G. Wodehouse

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Robert Asprin, editor
item.description: "When things are at their blackest, I say to myself, 'Cheer up, things could be worse.' And sure enough, they get worse." -- Robert Asprin, editor

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by James Branch Cabell
item.description: "The optimist proclaims that we live in the best of all possible worlds; and the pessimist fears this is true." -- James Branch Cabell

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who is a pessimist before 48 knows too much; if he is an optimist after it he knows too little." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Thich Nhat Hanh
item.description: "To think in terms of either pessimism or optimism oversimplifies the truth. The problem is to see reality as it is." -- Thich Nhat Hanh

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by John Kenneth Galbraith
item.description: "Man, at least when educated, is a pessimist. He believes it safer not to reflect on his achievements; Jove is known to strike such people down." -- John Kenneth Galbraith

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Alexander Pope
item.description: "Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall never be disappointed." -- Alexander Pope

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Art Williams
item.description: "I'm not telling you it's going to be easy - I'm telling you it's going to be worth it." -- Art Williams

item.title: Sabrina add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges
